Detailed Description

Provides the handling of the low level communications between the dynamixels and the controller

baudThe baud rate to use

Definition at line 145 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

Member Function Documentation

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::bulkRead ( std::vector< int > *  servo_ids,
uint16_t  address,
uint16_t  length,
std::map< int, std::vector< uint8_t > > *  responses 
)
protected

Performs the bulk read for each protocol. A bulk read is a broadcast instruction on a bus that commands a list of dynamixels to respond in order with a read of a specified address and length (which can be different for each dynamixel). This protocol can be used to read many parameters from many dynamixels on a bus in just one instruction.

Parameters
servo_idsPointer to a list of ID's to respond. Dynamixels will respond in order of list index
addressThe address value in the control table the dynamixels will start reading from
lengthThe number of bytes to read consecutively from the control table
responsesPointer map of dynamixel ID's to dynamixel response vectors, response vectors are a raw array of the bytes read from the control table of each dynamixel

Definition at line 316 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::getBulkConfigurationInfo ( std::vector< int > *  servo_ids,
std::map< int, std::vector< int32_t > > *  responses 
)

Bulk Reads the following status variables in one operation:

Protocol 1.0 (MX Series)

  • Model Number
  • Firmware Version
  • ID
  • BaudRate
  • Return Delay Time
  • CW Angle Limit
  • CCW Angle Limit
  • Max Temp Limit
  • Min Voltage Limit
  • Max Voltage Limit
  • Max Torque

Total 16 Bytes Consecutive

Protocol 2.0 (XM Series)

  • Model Number
  • Model Info
  • Firmware Version
  • ID
  • BaudRate
  • Return Delay Time
  • Operating Mode
  • Max Temp Limit
  • Max Voltage Limit
  • Min Voltage Limit
  • Max Torque (Current Limit)
  • Min Position Limit
  • Max Position Limit

Total 53 Bytes Consecutive

Protocol 2.0 (XM Series)

  • Model Number
  • Model Info
  • Firmware Version
  • ID
  • BaudRate
  • Return Delay Time
  • Operating Mode
  • Max Temp Limit
  • Max Voltage Limit
  • Min Voltage Limit
  • Max Torque
  • Max Position Limit
  • Min Position Limit

Total 41 Bytes Consecutive

Parameters
servo_idsPointer to a list of ID's to respond. Dynamixels will respond in order of list index
responsesPointer map of dynamixel ID's to dynamixel response vectors, response vectors are a list of parameter values in the order given above.
Returns
True on comm success, false otherwise

Definition at line 1221 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::getBulkStateInfo ( std::vector< int > *  servo_ids,
std::map< int, std::vector< int32_t > > *  responses 
)

Bulk Reads the following values in one instruction

  • Present Position
  • Present Velocity
  • Present Current (or load if MX Series)
Parameters
servo_idsPointer to a list of ID's to respond. Dynamixels will respond in order of list index
responsesPointer map of dynamixel ID's to dynamixel response vectors, response vectors are a list of parameter values in the order given above.
Returns
True on comm success, false otherwise

Definition at line 1330 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::getBulkStatusInfo ( std::vector< int > *  servo_ids,
std::map< int, std::vector< int32_t > > *  responses 
)

Bulk Reads the following servo state variables in one instruction

Protocol 1.0 (MX Series)

  • goal Pos
  • moving speed
  • torque limit
  • present position
  • present velocity
  • present load
  • present voltage
  • present temperature Total 14 Bytes conescutive

Protocol 2.0 (XM Series)

  • goal position
  • realtime tick
  • moving
  • moving status
  • present pwm
  • present current
  • present position
  • velocity trajectory
  • position trajectory
  • present voltage
  • present temperature Total 31 Bytes Consecutive

Protocol 2.0 (Pro Series)

  • Goal Position
  • Goal Velocity
  • Goal Torque
  • Goal Acceleration
  • Moving
  • Present Position
  • Present Velocity
  • Present Current
  • present voltage
  • present temperature Total 30 Bytes Consecutive
Parameters
servo_idsPointer to a list of ID's to respond. Dynamixels will respond in order of list index
responsesPointer map of dynamixel ID's to dynamixel response vectors, response vectors are a list of parameter values in the order given above.
Returns
True on comm success, false otherwise

Definition at line 274 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::getLoad ( int  servo_id,
uint16_t &  load 
)

Retrieves the current load value from the dynamixel's ram. In the case of XM and Pro series, this value is the same as that returned by getCurrent() as they use current to measure load. For MX this value is a percentage of the limit defined in the max torque register.

Parameters
servo_idThe ID of the servo to retrieve from
loadStores the value returned
Returns
True on comm success, false otherwise.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::ping ( int  servo_id)

Ping the specified id, used to check if a dynamixel with that ID is on the bus

Parameters
servo_idThe ID to ping on the bus.
Returns
True if a dynamixel responds, false otherwise.

Definition at line 158 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::readRegisters ( int  servo_id,
uint32_t  address,
uint32_t  length,
uint8_t *  response 
)

Retrieves arbitrary register readings from the Dynamixel, can be used in cases where provided getters are insufficient or to read multiple contiguous values at once.

Parameters
servo_idThe ID of the servo to retrieve from
addressThe address value in the control table the dynamixel will start reading from
lengthThe number of bytes to read consecutively from the control table
responseArray to store the raw dynamixel response.

Definition at line 1128 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::setAngleLimits ( int  servo_id,
int32_t  min_angle,
int32_t  max_angle 
)

Sets the minimum and maximum angle limits for the dynamixel

Parameters
servo_idThe ID of the servo to write to
min_anglethe minimum angle limit (in encoder values)
max_anglethe maximum angle limit (in encoder values)
Returns
True on comm success, false otherwise.

Definition at line 1922 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::setBaudRate ( int  servo_id,
uint8_t  baud_rate 
)

Writes a new baud rate value to the dynamixels eeprom.

Parameters
servo_idThe ID of the servo to write to
baud_rateThe new baud rate for the dynamixel. Values are defined as follows:
  • Value = 0-249: Baud = 2Mbps/ (value + 1)
  • Value = 250: Baud = 2.25Mbps
  • Value = 251: Baud = 2.5Mbps
  • Value = 252: Baud = 3Mbps
  • Value = 253,254: INVALID, DO NOT SET
Returns
True on comm success and valid baud rate, false otherwise.

Definition at line 1690 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::setId ( int  servo_id,
uint8_t  new_id 
)

Writes a new ID value to the Dynamixel's eeprom. The value MUST be unique or all dynamixel's with the same ID on a bus will fail to respond.

Parameters
servo_idThe ID of the servo to write to
new_idThe new ID to set this dynamixel to
Returns
True on comm success iff new_id not already in use, false otherwise.

Definition at line 2920 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::setOperatingMode ( int  servo_id,
uint8_t  operating_mode 
)

Sets the Operating mode of the Dynamixel. The three possible control modes are: Position, Velocity or Torque. The way these modes are enabled differs for each series of dynamixel. XM and Pro have an operating mode register that can be used to changed the control type. For MX series, the method of control is defined by the values in the angle limit registers and the torque_control_enable register. Note torque control is not available on the MX-28 models.

Parameters
servo_idThe ID of the servo to write to
operating_modeThe method of control: values are defined as:
  • 0: Torque Control
  • 1: Velocity Control
  • 3: Position Control
Returns
True on comm success and valid operating mode, false otherwise.

Definition at line 1790 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::setPIDGains ( int  servo_id,
uint8_t  operating_mode,
double  p_gain,
double  i_gain,
double  d_gain 
)

Sets the PID gains for the dynamixel. note that the PID gains are available based on series and control type:

  • MX Series:
    • Position: P,I,D
    • Velocity: P,I,D
    • Torque: P,I,D
  • XM Series:
    • Position: P,I,D
    • Velocity: P,I
    • Torque: None
  • Pro Series:
    • Position: P
    • Velocity: P,I
    • Torque: None
Parameters
servo_idThe ID of the servo to write to
operating_modeThe operating mode to set gains for.
See Also
setOperatingMode
Parameters
p_gainThe proportional gain value to write
i_gainThe integral gain value to write
d_gainThe derivative gain value to write
Returns
True on comm success, false otherwise.

Definition at line 2448 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::syncRead ( std::vector< int > *  servo_ids,
uint16_t  address,
uint16_t  length,
std::map< int, std::vector< uint8_t > > *  responses 
)
protected

Performs the bulk read for each protocol. A bulk read is a broadcast instruction on a bus that commands a list of dynamixels to respond in order with a read of a specified address and length (the same value for all dynamixels read) This protocol can be used to read many parameters from many dynamixels on a bus in just one instruction.

Parameters
servo_idsPointer to a list of ID's to respond. Dynamixels will respond in order of list index
addressThe address value in the control table the dynamixels will start reading from
lengthThe number of bytes to read consecutively from the control table
responsesPointer map of dynamixel ID's to dynamixel response vectors, response vectors are a raw array of the bytes read from the control table of each dynamixel

Definition at line 1557 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::syncWrite ( std::vector< std::vector< int > >  value_pairs,
uint32_t  address,
uint32_t  length,
float  protocol 
)
protected

Performs the sync write for each protocol. A sync write is a broadcast instruction on a bus that commands a list of dynamixels to write a value into a specified address (the value written can be different for each dynamixel but the address is universal). This can be used to update a parameter (say goal position) for many dynamixels, each with a unique value, all in one instruction.

Parameters
value_pairsA vector of tuples, each tuple containing a dynamixel ID and a write value.
addressThe address value in the control table the dynamixels will write to
lengthThe number of bytes to write
protocolThe protocol version to use

Definition at line 3119 of file dynamixel_new_driver.cpp.

bool dynamixel_new_driver::DynamixelNewDriver::writeRegisters ( int  servo_id,
uint32_t  address,
uint32_t  length,
uint8_t *  data 
)

CAUTION: THIS FUNCTION IS PROVIDED AS IS, WRITE VALUES AND ADDRESSESARE NOT CHECKED FOR SENSIBILITY OR VALIDITIY, ENSURE THAT VALUES ARE CHECKED FOR CORRECT ADDRESS AND VALUES BEFORE CALLING THIS FUNCTION, OTHERWISE DYNAMIXELS MAY HAVE TO BE RESET. Writes arbitrary register values to the Dynamixel, can be used in cases where provided setters are insufficient or to write multiple contiguous values at once.

Parameters
servo_idThe ID of the servo to write to
addressThe address value in the control table the dynamixel will start writing to
lengthThe number of bytes to write consecutively to the control table
dataArray containing the value to be written.
Returns
True on comm success, false otherwise.
